The Rivers and Beacon-hills of Gondor

wikitext.*:
'''RAN''' is a [[Common Eldarin]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "wander, stray, meander, go on uncertain course".<ref name=VT>{{VT|42a}}, pp. 12, 13 (root appearing as "RAN")</ref> There is also an alternative form of the root, '''RĂNĂ''', said to signify "wander".<ref name=PE>{{PE|17}}, p. 60 (root appearing as "√RĂNĂ")</ref>

==Derivatives==
*RAN
**[[Quenya]]: ''ranya'' ("erratic wandering"); ''[[Moon#Other names|Rána]]''<ref name=VT/>
**Sindarin: ''rein'', ''rain'' ("erratic wandering"); ''[[randir|randír]]''<ref name=VT/>

*RĂNĂ
**[[Sindarin]] ''[[randir]]''<ref name=PE/>

==Other versions==
In the ''[[The Etymologies|Etymologies]]'' appears the [[Primitive Quendian]] root RAN ("wander, stray"). Among its derivatives are:<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 383 (root appearing as "RAN-")</ref>

*Primitive Quendian: ''[[Moon#Other names|Ranā]]'' ("Moon")
**Quenya: ''[[Moon#Other names|Rana]]''
**[[Noldorin]]: ''[[Moon#Other names|Rhân]]''

*Quenya: ''ranya-'' ("to stray"); ''ráne'' ("straying, wandering"); ''ránen'' ("errant")
*Noldorin: ''rhenio'' ("to stray"); ''rhaun'' ("errant"); ''[[rhandir]]''

*Primitive Quendian: ''(a)raniā'' ("free, [?uncontrolling]")<ref name=Corr>{{VT|46a}}, p. 10</ref><ref group=note>The "i" in ''(a)raniā'' has an [[Wikipedia:Inverted breve|inverted breve below]]:  ̯.</ref>
**Noldorin: ''[[rhain|rhain, rhein]]''<ref name=Corr/>
**Quenya: ''[[(a)ranya]]''<ref name=Corr/>
